page.title: 01Principle Features
page.content: The area is mainly{rural}, with the south half of the country town of Buckingham and the eastern portion of Gawcott village being the only areas of population. About 75% of the area is farmland. The River {Ouse }meanders eastwards through the town. There is some manufacturing present, an{engineering }works and to the west a paint factory and to the south a larger one making lighting products for the car industry. A new{ring road}carries the A421 in a loop south of the town. The small {University,}the first of its kind in the country, has largely made use of existing buildings within the the town itself. A number of new {housing {developements }are infilling between the old town and the ring road.
